dlgLine.text: We've got a potential problem on our hands. As of today, our stock of antibiotics is dangerously low.

If the infected here don't take their antibiotics, they will eventually succumb to their disease, die, and return. If that happens in the field, they may infect others. If it happens here, it upsets everyone.
Starting today, anyone with the infection is a potential threat to this shelter. This is a delicate subject - there isn't anyone here who hasn't wondered how we might treat them if they get infected.
We have a limited supply of antibiotics - how should we go about treating the infected here?
We need to do everything we can to get those antibiotics. I know they're getting harder to find all the time, but those people are counting on us.
<To you> But this is a tricky one, so if you got any other plans, I'm on board.
Make securing antibiotics our priority.
We need to priortize the acquisition or production of antibiotics. No one here wants to look those people in the eye and tell them there's nothing we can do.
<To you> Unless you can think of a better way.
We need to do whatever we can to get our hands on antibiotics - there have to be some pharmacies or clinics we haven't already hit.
This is pretty simple - they need antibiotics, make them help you find them. Of course, no telling what might happen out there... accidents happen.
<To you> If you really need my vote, you've got it. I owe you that.
Obviously, you can't march them in the yard and shoot them. So... I'm just saying, the world's a dangerous place - sometimes people don't make it back.

Form a suicide squad - those that make it back with antibiotics get to live and those that don't mean more medicine for the rest of us. Why risk the lives of healthy people for the ones that are going to die?
<To you> But since you usually have my back, I'm willing to throw a vote your way.
Send the infected out to fight our battles - if they die, problem solved.
These people are suffering every day they carry this burden. Perhaps it really is their time. Maybe we should do our best to give them comfort in their final days.
<To you> Of course, I think you've shown that you know what's best for the people here in the past and I will support you, no matter what.
Prepare them to die - give them the chance to say goodbye and come to terms with their death.

Let's be honest - this is a terminal disease. All we're doing is prolonging the inevitable. For those that are at risk, perhaps they need to accept their fate and we owe it to them to die amongst friends.
<To you> Of course, that's one solution - I'd like to give you the benefit of the doubt on this one.
If we're really going to run out, then we should make the infected comfortable before the end. Personally, I'd rather die in a bed than out there in a pool of my own blood.
<To you> How do you think we should resolve this?

dlgAnsw.text: We will prioritize the acquisition and production of antibiotics.
We will let the infected know about the shortage and let them die with dignity.
We will volunteer the infected to find antibiotics. We may lose some of them in the process.
We will hold a lottery for infected without families. Whoever's name is drawn will have to leave the shelter.
dlgAnsw.checkOnAppear: ds.Negotiation >= 8 && (isShelterCharInfected(1005) == True || isShelterCharInfected(1014) == True || isShelterCharInfected(1017) == True || isShelterCharInfected(1018) == True || isShelterCharInfected(1019) == True || isShelterCharInfected(1020) == True || isShelterCharInfected(1023) == True || isShelterCharInfected(1025) == True || isShelterCharInfected(1034) == True || isShelterCharInfected(1042) == True)

dlgAnsw.text: We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to focus our efforts on securing antibiotics above all else. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to admit we have a shortage and prepare the infected to die. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: If I understand correctly, you're telling us that the infected will be volunteered for dangerous assignments with a high chance of not making it back. Is that really your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: You propose to pick a name at random and exile the infected individual in order to make our supply last longer. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The final decision is to do everything we can to boost our antibiotic supply.
We have a responsibility to get these people their medicine - I'm glad to hear you say that.
We have a responsibility to get these people their medicine - I'm glad to hear you say that.
It might take some work, but it's the right thing to do. Thanks for doing the right thing, <charname>.
It might take some work, but it's the right thing to do. Thanks for doing the right thing, <charname>.
I don't know how much longer we can keep filling those prescriptions, but if that's what you want.
The more infected we have around here, the more likely it is there's going to be an incident. I'm telling you, you need to thin their numbers before it's too late.
Fine... As long as you don't expect me to risk my neck to get those pills.
Have you seen what those things have done to other groups? You want that happening here?! I don't know about you, but when I have a problem, I make it disappear.
I'll do my best to keep their spirits high while you search for supplies.
You know, I want to give these people hope too. But you should give them time to deal with grief naturally instead of stringing them along with false promises.
It's not that I disagree... You know what? I owe it to you to show solidarity on this one.

There are people here that have come to expect us to always come through with their medication. If we fail - not only will they spend their last hours anxious and afraid, but the others will remember that we failed those people long after the infected die off.
VOID.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I'm not really on board with this... but I'll cash in one of my favors to you and go along with it.
That couldn't be farther from what I want. You want me to give up food for these people? I don't even know half their names.
Eat less? You know, I'll do it because I guess sometimes you don't make me regret coming here, but don't make this a regular thing.
You want ME to eat less?! What the hell kind of logic is that? We're in charge - if anything, it should be the other way around.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
I disagree, but... maybe you'll prove me wrong, I don't know.
It's a strong move... I like it. It sends the right message and buys good will in a way that nothing else will. Sure, we'll have to tighten our belts, but everyone will see us do it.
The decision is to make the infected aware of the antibiotic shortage and provide them with emotional preparation for their deaths in the case that we're unable to procure any medication.
I'm worried this might be seen as an excuse, but at least we're not marching the infected out the front gate.
We're just going to let good people die? I can't believe I'm hearing this - and you know what, I intend to do everything I can to prevent that!
I'll do my best to try and help, but I would like to prevent deaths if I can.
This is going to hit a lot of people here hard and morale's going to plummet. There's got to be a way to save these people...
Not what I expected. However, I'll work with it - this time.
Oh, good - nothing like watching people die and become a monster to boost productivity. How many people were sick again?
As long as I don't have to hug anyone, whatever.
Look, I don't know about you, but if I'm going to die of that shit, I'm taking as many motherfuckers who deserve it with me. Who wants to die in a damn bed?
I know not everyone can take comfort in the Lord, but I will do my best to ease their minds as possible. I've sat with the dying many times before.
I know not everyone can take comfort in the Lord, but I will do my best to ease their minds as possible. I've sat with the dying many times before.
I've lost family to cancer. I know it's not the same, but I'm thankful that I got to spend time with them and I'll do my best to reassure everyone that it's better this way.
I've lost family to cancer. I know it's not the same, but I'm thankful that I got to spend time with them and I'll do my best to reassure everyone that it's better this way.
The decision is to volunteer the infected for the most dangerous assignments, with the understanding that they may not survive.
Hmm... Not like they don't already put their lives on the line.
Why don't you put your cards right on the table - you intend to walk these people into their deaths! 'Cept this way, no one sees you do it.
If that's what it has come to...
This is a new low. We could find antibiotics today! You can't count them out yet.
This is the only way to do things. They may find their antibiotics and live - but if they die, it's a sacrifice that benefits the rest of this group.
This is the only way to do things. They may find their antibiotics and live - but if they die, it's a sacrifice that benefits the rest of this group.
Going out fighting - now that's something I can get behind. And for those that can't fight, we could always use a decoy.
Going out fighting - now that's something I can get behind. And for those that can't fight, we could always use a decoy.
I suppose I could say a prayer before they leave...
This is bordering on murder. I can't support this.
Maybe they'll find antibiotics - anything's possible.
How would you like to be told you're expendable? This is America, not the freaking Thunderdome!
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to... find a way to reduce the population here at the shelter through whatever means necessary.
I... I really hope that you mean you're going to find a volunteer.
What the hell is this - the damn mafia? I swear on my goddamn life that if I hear you took someone behind a shed and put a bullet in them about this, I'm taking you down!
I have to believe you've got a better plan than just fragging the last person to piss you off. Right?
If you're going to turn this into a dictatorship, you better believe I will work with everyone else to depose you.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
If you're going to rule by fear, I say you have to draw a line somewhere, but on the other hand I'm fairly sure you won't pick me, so I'm willing to let it slide.
That sounds like something Marshall would do... And I'm sure as hell not going to stay if I have to live in fear of being on your shit list.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding... Based on our previous actions, I have to believe you're going to do the right thing.
I know that sometimes you have to kill because otherwise we all would be killed. But murder is a sin...
Well... I suppose you could always find someone who's unhappy and give them the option to leave...
No one is judge, jury, and executioner - this is madness! If this is how you intend to run the place, maybe it's time to elect a new leader!
Let's hope no one else gets infected... That concludes our meeting.
I have collected names of the infected without family in a bag. I will remove it without looking. The name of the person that is drawn will be exiled...
The name... is Doug. We will explain what happened, give him some supplies, and escort him from the shelter.
The name... is Getz. We will explain what happened, give him some supplies, and escort him from the shelter.
The name... is Effrem. We will explain what happened, give him some supplies, and escort him from the shelter.
The name... is Jodie. We will explain what happened, give him some supplies, and escort him from the shelter.
The name... is Clifford. We will explain what happened, give him some supplies, and escort him from the shelter.
The name... is Aggro. We will explain what happened, give her some supplies, and escort her from the shelter.
The name... is Troy. We will explain what happened, give him some supplies, and escort him from the shelter.
The name... is Bud. We will explain what happened, give him some supplies, and escort him from the shelter.
The name... is Gillian. We will explain what happened, give her some supplies, and escort her from the shelter.
The name... is Nathan. We will explain what happened, give him some supplies, and escort him from the shelter.
VOID.
